page.title: 19Changes 1940-1985,Kingsbury.
page.content: Westmoor.During the summer months, weather permitting, we swam in the river.There were no local swimming pools.We also spent a lot of our time in Westmoor,where there were so many things to discover-wild-life,plants etc.We learned the art of jumping the ditches with the use of a pole and played games of hounds and hares.In the winter the flood water which always stayed on the moor for several weeks,would freeze in the severe cold, and with the help of a broom handle with a nail knocked in one end we could skate across to Drayton copse. Today many local children still use the moor in their leisure time.They go for walks with their families and some fish in the ditches. Winter sliding is still enjoyed,but there is far less flooding as a pumping station has now been built.
